chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 16 - Use/Threat of Force/Violence

result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Wayne Clipps was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all court costs, surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with victim C.G.  No unsupervised contact with childen under the age of 18 years.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant must register as a sex offender.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

Defendant's pro se motion to restore appellate rights.
Original Transcript SENTENCE (30 pages) commencing JANUARY 13, 2015 received and filed.
See case no. 14cf579 for request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 1/12/15 for Candice G. for 1 appearance on 1/12/15.

Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.
As to count 1:   The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 39 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 341 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 21 MONTHS. 
As to count 2:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 74 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to count 1, credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 40 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 34 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Defendant must register as a sex offender.
-No contact with victim, CG.  No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18 years.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Credit; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Ineligible Voting.

AS to each count in the AMENDED Information:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Defendant advised of potential sex registry and of Chapter 980 filing.
Victim statement by CG, dob 7-6-1999.
Jury pool is released from jury room and returned to jury management.
Defendant is remanded and sentencing adjourned to 1-13-2015 at 8:15.

Amended Information filed.  Parties have reached a resolution.
Count 1: Exposing Genitals to a Minor, a class I felony, 948.10(1)(a)
Count 2: Felon in Possession of  Firearm, a class G felony, 941.29(1)(a) and (2)(a).

Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin, as Assistant Attorney General.
State moves to amend count 2 of the Information to reflect a birthdate of 7-6-1999 to be consistent with date reflected in criminal complaint.
Defendant wishes to proceed to trial.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:57am. 
Court recessed for lunch at 12:05pm. Jurors are ordered to return at 1:00pm. Court admonishes jury not to conduct any independent investigation.
State places on record 'alternate' resolutions that would be acceptable to the state.  Defendant has rejected offers. 
Negotiations have been on-going over the lunch recess.
Case recalled.  All parties are present in court.
Case is adjourned to 1-12-2015 for speedy trial.

Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State advises that the defense was provided with the debriefing that was done as to Ms. Gholston.
State has made an offer to defendant to resolve this case and that offer is placed on the record.
The defendant REJECTS offer and is making a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Attorney Scott F. Anderson in court, defendant Charles Wayne Clipps not in court, in custody.  Miriam S. Falk, Assistant Atty General appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance is waived.
Matter is set for jury today.  Co-defendant has entered a plea and will be de-briefed by the state and MPD. 
Atty Anderson is requesting a date for resolution later this week.  Case set for 10-16-2014 at 8:15.

Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Proposed redactions to the Forensic Interview have been submitted by counsels.
The defense will accept the state's redactions.
Case remains in trial posture for 10-13-2014.
Filed:  State's Notice of Motion and Motion to Introduce "Other Acts" RE:  Ghoston

Attorney Scott F. Anderson in court, defendant Charles Wayne Clipps not in court, in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The State wishes to respond to defense Proposed redactions of C. G. Forensic Interview Disc filed on todays date.  The State has filed Proposed Redactions of Forensic Interview and a Supplemental Witness List and also adds Sara McLaughlin. Matter is set for hearing on 9-22-2014 at 8:15.  
Co-counsel is not involved with this matter and will not be appearing.

Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion hearing held. For reasons stated on the record the Court grants the :
State's motion to introduce evidence of illegal drug use expert testimony.
State's motion to introduce expert testimony.
Defense motion for adjournment of jury trial.  Jury trial scheduled for 07/14/2014 vacated.
  
The Court is provided with a recorded copy of the victim interview.  Court orders parties to submit redactions of the recording by 08/28/2014.  Case remains calendared in Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties met in chambers.  Case is adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 38.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Scott F Anderson in court, defendant Charles Wayne Clipps not in court, in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State has presented the last portion of discovery to defense counsel.  Atty Anderson has not had the chance to respond to State's motion to Introduce Illegal Drug Use and the State has not had the chance to review briefs filed by Atty McClune.  The Court will adjourn matter to 6-30-2014 for final pretrial and motions,  Jury trial date of 7-14-2014 to stand.

Attorney Scott F Anderson in court, defendant Charles Wayne Clipps not in court, in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for Miriam Falk for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Falk remains in trial in Branch 25.  Atty Anderson will be picking up  discovery from DA's office this morning. Atty Anderson is available on the previously set dates of 6-3-2014 for final pretrial and 7-14-2014 for jury trial.

Atty Scott Anderson contacts the court to advise that he will be in Racine this morning and cannot appear until later today.  ADA Falk is in continuing trial from last week in Br. 25 and unable to appear later today.  Atty Anderson is available on the scheduled dates.  Case is adjourned to 5-21-2014 at 8:15 for status.

Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in court with attorney Thomas E Harris.  Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  State Public Defender to appoint new counsel.  Case is adjourned to 5-19-2014 at 8:15am for status of counsel.
Atty Harris contacts the clerk that he will be moving to withdraw on this case.  He has notifed the State Public Defender office.  Case set for 5-9-2014 at 8:15 for motion to withdraw.
Motion For Reduction Of Bail
Notice Of Motion

Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in court with attorney Thomas E Harris.  Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Harris was appointed yesterday and has not received discovery from prior counsel.  Counsel that is appointed to this case is to be available for the previously set dates of 6-3-14 for final pretrial and 7-14-14 for jury trial.  Atty Harris believes that he is available for the trial date, but is requesting a week to confirm his availability.  The Court directs counsel to advise the clerk by 5-14-2014 if he is able to keep this case with the set dates.
Motions are to be filed by 5-23-2013 and any evidentiary hearings will be on the final pretrial date.

Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense motion to withdraw as counsel granted by the court.  Court directs that new counsel be appointed by the SPD who is available on the already set dates of June 3 for final pretrial and July 14 for the jury trial.
Defendant is to be produced on next date of 5-6-2014 for status.

Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has not filed a motion for severance for strategic reasons.
State's offer is placed on the record.  Defendant rejects the offer.
Final pretrial date, 6-3-2014  to stand.  Jury trial date of 7-14-2014 remains.
Defense motion to modify bail is argued and DENIED.  Bail to remain the same.  Defense clearly states that a speedy trial demand is NOT being entered.

Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense counsel will be filing motion for severance with 14CF579 due to antagonistic defense.  State will be requesting that cases proceed on same date with dual jury panels.
Case set for final pretrial on 6-13-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 7-14-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed within 17 days of today.   Motion to sever to be heard on 4-3-2014.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing  FEBRUARY 13, 2014  received and filed. (17 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Steve Sargent - SPD  819 N 6th Street  Milwaukee, WI  53202.

ADA Miriam Falk is requesting a new date for arraignment/bail hearing as she will be out of town on 3-3-2014.  ADA Falk has contact defense counsel and the new agreed upon date is 3-10-2014 at 8:15.  State to send confirming letter to court and counsels.

Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in custody.  Paul Tiffin for Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Sarah Blomme-MPD Detective,  Angela Phillips-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Bail/Bond Hearing and Arraignment scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CG her residence or her school; or Co-Actor Earnestine Ghoston

Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Charles Wayne Clipps in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38. Court orders Count 2 of the complaint amended to read the correct birthdate of the Victim as 7/6/1999.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
